terms.title: Terms of Service
terms.intro: By using ODAN, you agree to these terms. Please read them carefully.

sections.title: 1. Acceptance of Terms
sections.content: By accessing or using ODAN, you agree to be bound by these Terms of Service. If you do not agree, please do not use our services.

sections.title: 2. Description of Service
sections.content: ODAN is a free, open-source platform that connects people seeking tech help with volunteers. We facilitate communication but do not guarantee the quality or accuracy of assistance provided.

sections.title: 3. User Responsibilities
sections.content: You agree to use ODAN respectfully and lawfully. You must not share illegal content, harass users, or misuse the platform. Volunteers must provide honest, good-faith assistance.

sections.title: 4. Privacy and Data
sections.content: We collect minimal data necessary to operate the service. Chat messages are not permanently stored. See our Privacy Policy for details.

sections.title: 5. Intellectual Property
sections.content: ODAN is open-source software. User-generated content remains the property of its creators, but by posting you grant us license to display it on the platform.

sections.title: 6. Limitation of Liability
sections.content: ODAN is provided 'as is' without warranties. We are not liable for any damages arising from use of the platform or advice received through it.

sections.title: 7. Changes to Terms
sections.content: We may update these terms periodically. Continued use after changes constitutes acceptance of the new terms.

privacy.title: Privacy Policy
privacy.intro: Your privacy is important to us. This policy explains how we collect, use, and protect your information.

sections.title: 1. Information We Collect
sections.content: We collect information you provide when signing up (name, email if using non-Telegram providers) and basic usage data. Chat messages are processed but not permanently stored.

sections.title: 2. How We Use Information
sections.content: We use your information to provide and improve our services, send notifications about your tickets, and generate volunteer certificates.

sections.title: 3. Data Sharing
sections.content: We do not sell your data. We may share anonymized statistics publicly. Volunteer certificate information is made publicly verifiable by design.

sections.title: 4. Data Security
sections.content: We implement reasonable security measures to protect your information. However, no system is completely secure.

sections.title: 5. Your Rights
sections.content: You can request access to, correction of, or deletion of your personal data by contacting us. Volunteer certificates cannot be deleted due to their verifiable nature.

sections.title: 6. Cookies
sections.content: We use essential cookies for authentication and language preferences. We do not use tracking or advertising cookies.

sections.title: 7. Contact
sections.content: For privacy-related questions, contact us through the Contact page or open a ticket.

about.title: Open Digital Assistance Network
about.subtitle: A free, open-source platform connecting people who need tech help with volunteers who care.

mission.title: Our Mission
mission.content: To democratize access to tech support by creating a transparent, safe, and human-centered platform where everyone can get help and anyone can volunteer.

values.title: Accessibility
values.description: Free tech help for everyone, regardless of income or location.

values.title: Transparency
values.description: Open source, verifiable certificates, and auditable processes.

values.title: Community
values.description: Built by volunteers, for everyone. No ads, no hidden agendas.

values.title: Recognition
values.description: Volunteers earn verifiable certificates for their contributions.

values.title: Privacy
values.description: Minimal data collection, no tracking, messages not permanently stored.

values.title: Innovation
values.description: Modern tools like whiteboard and rich editor for better assistance.

story.title: How It Started
story.content: ODAN was born from the belief that tech help shouldn't cost money or come with strings attached. We saw people struggling with technical issues and volunteers willing to help but no easy way to connect them safely. So we built it: a platform with live chat, certificates for volunteers, and moderation to keep everyone safe.

openSource.title: 100% Open Source
openSource.description: Our entire codebase is public. Audit it, contribute to it, or fork it.
